1. "Interstellar" (2014) - A space adventure film directed by Christopher Nolan, this movie explores the concept of wormholes to travel through space and time in search of humanity's new home.

2. "Blade Runner 2049" (2017) - This sequel to the original Blade Runner follows a new blade runner, played by Ryan Gosling, who uncovers secrets about the past that could change the future of humanity.

3. "The Martian" (2015) - A film based on Andy Weir's novel, it tells the story of an astronaut stranded on Mars and his struggle to survive and find a way back to Earth.

4. "Arrival" (2016) - This thought-provoking movie explores communication with alien life forms and the impact on human civilization when they arrive on Earth.

5. "Minority Report" (2002) - Directed by Steven Spielberg, this film is set in a future where crimes can be predicted and prevented before they occur, leading to questions about free will and the consequences of crime prevention measures.

6. "Ex Machina" (2014) - A thriller that focuses on a programmer who is invited to evaluate an intelligent humanoid robot created by his employer, but soon finds himself questioning his own humanity and sanity.
